intro: Chironia linoides subsp. linoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf chironia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered. It is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
